sigir-20141.raw: A 58-year-old African-American woman presents to the ER with episodic pressing/burning anterior chest pain that began two days earlier for the first time in her life. The pain started while she was walking, radiates to the back, and is accompanied by nausea, diaphoresis and mild dyspnea, but is not increased on inspiration. The latest episode of pain ended half an hour prior to her arrival. She is known to have hypertension and obesity. She denies smoking, diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, or a family history of heart disease. She currently takes no medications. Physical examination is normal. The EKG shows nonspecific changes.

gpt-4-turbo.summary: A 58-year-old African-American woman with a history of hypertension and obesity presents with episodic pressing/burning anterior chest pain radiating to the back, accompanied by nausea, diaphoresis, and mild dyspnea. The pain is not increased on inspiration and started while walking. She denies smoking, diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, or a family history of heart disease. Physical examination is normal, and the EKG shows nonspecific changes.
